title: chore: Update lock file after version bump
chore: Version bump for 0.15.0 release
tests: Run fuzzing as part of CI
body: Run each of the fuzz targets for 60 seconds as part of CI.

title: tests: Fuzz Memcached::get with more than one value
body:
Refactor the fuzz test for Memcached::get to include more than one value and a proper `END` after all values.

Related #215

title: refactor: use tokio::fs for loading TLS certs
tests: Add README for fuzzing and a stats target
body: Add a README that explains how to setup and run fuzzing and add another target for the `Memcached::stats()` method.

title: tests: Introduce fuzz testing and fix issues identified
body: Add fuzz testing for some DNS parsing methods and Memcached methods. This change also fixes an issue with large payloads returned by Memcached servers that could overflow a `usize` integer.

title: chore: Update to latest dependencies
dns: Use unsafe function for converting labels to str
body: When displaying a `Name` object, use str::from_utf8_unchecked since it avoids testing for valid UTF-8. We know that the labels of the `Name` are valid UTF-8 already because we only allow ASCII characters.

title: chore: Add crate level lints and build/fmt with Rust 1.87
body: Add lints to the client and main crates and update to Rust 1.87 locally (which is responsible for all the import reordering)

title: dns: Move label length check outside of inner loop
body: Move the validation of each label length in a `Name` outside of the inner validation loop.

title: dns: Add tests for Name equality
body: Add tests to ensure `Name` equality is not case sensitive and do some superficial renaming of variables

title: dns: Refactor `Name` parsing to improve performance
body: Refactor DNS `Name` parsing code to avoid unnecessary conversions to strings. This results in between 15 and 20% improvement in benchmarks.

title: test: Add DNS Name benchmarks
body: Use criterion to benchmark DNS Name methods

title: dns: Add additional test for `Name` reading network bytes
dns: Clean up duplicate code in `Name` parsing
body: Refactor code for pasing DNS `Name`s from network bytes to remove some duplicated logic.

title: tests: Add unit tests for DNS client
body: Add unit tests and supporting test code for the DNS client to verify its retry and multiple server behavior. This change also moves TLS testing code to the integration tests instead of making it public in the client crate.

title: client: Unify ServerID and ServerAddress types
body: Replace `ServerID` implementation with `ServerAddress` since they ended up with nearly identical code. The new `ServerID` now acts as both the unique ID for a server and the address needed to connect to it.

title: Use `rustls-pki-types` for TLS PEM parsing
body: Remove dependency on rustls-pemfile since we are already using the rustls-pki-types crate

title: dns: Change client to try all servers then retry
body:
Change the retry behavior of the DNS client to try to get an answer from all configured nameservers and _then_ apply attempts to retry again if required. This change also adds some test code to make it easier to add tests for this behavior in a follow-up PR.

Fixes #200

title: fix: Only create ServerAddress from host _and_ port
body: Fix an issue where `ServerAddress` instances were sometimes created only from a hostname which could not be used to connect to a server.

title: Explicitly use `NetworkEndian` for all reads/writes
client: Introduce ServerAddress type
body:
Instead of relying on different types of strings to represent the address of each server (IP addresses, hostnames) use an enum with variants for sockets or hostnames. This allows us to extend the type with paths for UNIX sockets in the future.

Related https://github.com/56quarters/mtop/issues/191

title: Version bump for 0.14.0 release
Add support for `mc flush-all` to flush caches
body: Add support to `mc` for the Memcached `flush_all` command with an optional delay between which each server is flushed.

title: Preallocate vec for multiple keys
body:
When converting multiple strings to keys, allocate the vec for the keys ahead of time to avoid needing to grow the vec multiple times.

Additionally, fix the timing of `set`s for the `mc bench` command.

title: Remove some unnecessary clones from the high-level client
Import cleanup
Update to latest cargo-dist and don't plan on PR
Version bump for 0.13.1 release
dns: Fix an issue where a buffer was incorrectly reused
body: Fix an issue with the TCP DNS client where a buffer was not cleared between reuse resulting in TCP connections only being used for a single request and discarded (due to corrupt messages).

title: Make DefaultDnsClient generic for easier testing
body: Make the UDP and TCP client factories generic parameters for the DNS client to allow them to be replaced for unit testing. This change also renames the UDP and TCP "clients" to "connections" to emphasize that they are low level and just send messages back and forth.

title: Add another test around a DNS Name edge case
body: Add a test that confirms that Name.size() returns the same result for both FQDN and non-FQDN even though this is kind of confusing.

title: Version bump for 0.13 release
Deduplicate servers by ID when doing service discovery resolution
body:
Avoid duplicate servers when a SRV lookup returns the same host multiple times with different ports. We deduplicate based on server ID. We keep the same behavior of ignoring the port number from SRV records.

Fixes #184

title: Use constant for default resolv.conf path in binaries
Disallow zero values for CLI arguments where they don't make sense
body:
Use stdlib NonZero types to enforce that `0` isn't a valid value for some CLI flags (timeouts, number of connections/iterations).

Fixes #180

title: Integration testing for TLS connections via the client
body: Add integration tests that use real certificates to connect to a stub server and run a command against it over TLS. The server uses the same code to load certificates and keys and so it lives within the client crate (hidden).

title: Change output from `mc check` to group operations by type
Unit tests for queue used to share stats with the UI
Use the same expiration for all test certs
Reduce duplicate parsing code for simple responses
Make DNS client used by server discovery generic
body: Make the DNS client used by `Discovery` a generic parameter to make testing easier. This also makes the trait for the DNS client public since it must be created by the caller.

title: Add defaults for MemcachedClient generic parameters
body: Default to using `SelectorRendezvous` for the selector implementation and `TcpFactory` for the client factory implementation since this is what most consumers of the client use. Non-defaults are only used for unit tests.

title: Reorder method arguments for consistency and clean up comments
Remove has_errors method only used a single place
Add unit tests for MemcachedClient
body: Refactor MemcachedClient to make it unit testable and then add tests of a few representative methods. This change makes extracts the `Selector` logic for picking a server based on key to a trait and makes that type generic in the client. This is more verbose but allows us to use custom selector logic in the unit tests.

title: Add support for setting arguments using environment variables
Switch back to ring and bump version
Version bump and changelog for 0.12.0
Documentation about the internal DNS resolver and its limitations
Refactor DNS and Memcached clients to allow easier testing
body:
* Use pointers to traits for read and write sockets for DNS clients to allow use of alternate implementations and remove generic parameters from each client instance.
* Add generic parameter to `MemcachedClient` to allow use of an alternate factory that doesn't actually create network connections.

title: Switch to rustls_pki_types crate for TLS types
Update to latest versions of dependencies
body:
Notable changes:

* (tokio-)rustls switched to aws-lc-rs backend from ring

title: Convert name to be fully qualified to encode for `dns write`
Validate that the response to a `version` command looks correct
body:
Make the `Memcached::ping()` method more robust by verifying that the response to a `version` command looks vaguely like a valid response from Memcached.

Fixes #160

title: Don't attempt to resolve bare hostnames
body:
When connecting to Memcached servers, only attempt to resolve the hostnames to IP addresses when prefixed with `dns+`. If just a hostname is supplied, attempt to use it verbatim. This results in a better user experience since we get the benefits of using the system resolver and the expected hostname appears in the UI (instead of its IP).

Fixes #151

title: Various improvements to bench, check, ping commands
body:
Improvements for `mc bench` and `mc check`:

* Gracefully handle SIGINT, stopping the main loop
* Print summary information even when interrupted
* Change precision of timing output to 6 digits from 9
* Rename "total" time fields to "overall" for clarity
* Compute standard deviation using constant memory
* Simplify benchmarking code

Improvements for `dns ping`:

* Gracefully handle SIGINT, stopping the main loop
* Print summary information event when interrupted
* Support setting the nameserver to use explicitly instead of requiring a custom resolv.conf file

title: Fix cargo deprecation warning
Only return Memcached connections to the pool on success
body:
Only return connections to the pool if the request they were used for was successful or it was an expected protocol error from the server.

Fixes #153

title: Introduce pooling for DNS client and split net/pooling logic
body: Introduce a generic pooling type for use in both the DnsClient and MemcachedClient. This required splitting the pooling logic from the networking and TLS code.

title: Correctly propagate subscriber to newly spawned futures
body: Prevents logging in the client from breaking the terminal UI in `mtop`.

title: Version bump and changelog for 0.11.0 release
Add a `ping` command to the `dns` binary
body: Add a subcommand to the `dns` binary that repeatedly performs a DNS query and displays the time taken in a loop until stopped.

title: When parsing dns Names, avoid iterating each character twice
body: Speed up parsing of `Name` objects by building up labels and converting to lowercase at the same time we validate that each character is ASCII.

title: Add support for profiling to `dns` binary
body: Adding profiling support to `dns` binary to justify future performance improvements.

title: Add unit tests for some discovery logic
Don't try to resolve IP address hosts
body: When parsing CLI arguments, don't make a DNS query for hostnames that are already IP addresses. In this case, just connect to them.

title: dns: initial opt record support
body:
This change introduces the ability to parse OPT records but does not yet add them to requests or uses them when they are part of a response. A future PR will start making use of OPT records.

This change also does some unrelated cleanup, removing `--dns-local` flags from each of the binaries in favor of picking this value automatically. Additionally, the `--timeout-secs` option is removed from the `dns` binary since it has been unused since resolv.conf support was added.

Part of #107

title: Fix off-by-one error validating length of TXT record data
body: Fix off-by-one error when creating new RecordDataTXT records that would allow creation of objects that could never be serialized successfully.

title: Avoid lossy integer conversion in a few more places
Avoid lossy integer conversion where possible
Add missing `dns` binary to Docker image and bump version

labels.name: packaging
labels.description: Relating to build process or artifacts

title: Version bump for 0.10.0 release
Refactor `DnsClient` and introduce unit tests
body: Part of #107

title: Add TCP support to DNS client
body:
Add fallback to TCP for DNS client when the UDP message is trunctated.

Part of #107

title: Changelog and documentation updates
Read DNS settings from a resolv.conf file
body:
Allow some DNS settings to be read from a system's /etc/resolv.conf
file. Noteably, only the `nameserver` and a few `option`s are supported
for now. This change also switches resolution of A and AAAA names to
our DNS client instead of using the system resolver via `lookup_host`.


Part of #107

title: Allow DNS SRV records to be use to discover cache servers
body:
Adds support for discovering Memcached servers using DNS SRV records via the `dnssrv+` prefix on hostnames supplied for `mtop` and `mc`.

Part of #107

title: Update to latest version of cargo-dist
Implement a rudimentary DNS client for SRV record lookup
body:
This change creates a very basic DNS client capable of performing A, AAAA, CNAME, NS, SOA, TXT, and SRV types of queries. This is the first step in supporting DNS lookup of SRV records for service discovery in `mtop` and `mc`. It also adds a `dns` executable capable of making queries and parsing binary DNS messages.

This client has undergone very little testing and should be considered both experimental and internal to mtop.

See #107

title: Update default item TTL for `mc bench`

labels.name: area:mc
labels.description: Relating to the mc CLI tool

title: Dependency updates
Clean up client parsing logic to reduce duplication
Version bump for 0.9.0 release
Use unicode for finer grained gauges
Allow mtop theme to be set via CLI flag
body:
Allow color theme for the mtop UI to be set by the `--theme` flag. Available themes are "ansi", which uses only ANSI supported colors, "material", which uses a material color palette, and "tailwind", which uses a color palette based on tailwind CSS and is the default.

Fixes #123

title: Centralize UI in `theme` module and use tailwind palette
body:
Move the definition of the colors used in various mtop UI components to the `theme` module and create a few predefined themes. Currently, a dark theme using tailwind is the default. In the future different themes will be able to be selected.

Fixes #118

title: Avoid useless copies of fixture data in `mc bench`

labels.name: area:mc
labels.description: Relating to the mc CLI tool

title: Fix tab overflow from lots of hosts
body:
Allow all host tabs to be displayed even when there are more hosts than can fit on the screen. This fix is a bit of a cheat since we aren't actually moving the tabs, we just change the order of hosts based on user input. If this proves annoying to use we can look at actually moving the tabs around.

Fixes #117

title: Rename profiling module to avoid ambiguity
body: `mod pprof` was ambiguous in older versions of Rust since we were also referencing a dependency named `pprof`.

title: Improve release docs with step I always miss
Version bump for 0.8.0 release
Profiling support and performance improvements
body:
This change adds build-time support for collecting pprof profiling data when using the `mc` binary. Along with this, are a few performance improvements that came out of profiling.

* Don't do health checks on get or puts of connections by default. They're unnecessary most of the time and dramatically slow down benchmarks.
* Make the "score" used by rendezvous hashing simpler, just the hash of the server and key instead of taking the logarithm.
* Use a for-loop for scoring each server as part of server selection so that we don't compute the score for a particular server more than once.

Fixes #112

title: Add support for `mc bench` command to benchmark servers

labels.name: area:mc
labels.description: Relating to the mc CLI tool

body:
Add support for running simplistic benchmarks against a Memcached server. The purpose of the command is to provide an easy way to send _some_ amount of traffic to a server, not provide a comprehensive benchmark tool.

Fixes #109

title: Dependency updates
Use SocketAddr within Server abstraction
body:
Rework the way `Server` in the client works such that it wraps an address and server name instead of a string used for both connection and TLS name resolution. This change also indexes server-specific results (stats, meta, etc.) by ServerID instead of Server. ServerID is an opaque unique ID for a particular server.

Fixes #103

title: Fix PR number in changelog
Introduce high-level MemcachedClient
body:
Create a high-level client that interacts with multiple Memcached servers depending on the key or operation being performed. The client uses rendezvous hashing to determine which server is responsible for any relevant keys.

In addition the following improvements have been made:
* `Key` type introduced to validate keys before using them
* `mc` has been rewritten to clean up resources properly

The following things are missing and will done in follow up work:
* Tests for newly introduced client and hashing
* Type-safe alternative to string hostnames

title: Typos
